intro: Corydalis wardii, commonly known as the Chinese larkspur, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant features slender, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Corydalis wardii is often grown for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and compact growth habit. It prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for woodland or rock garden settings.
